ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush contact me at sherricrochets@gmail com abracadabra pattern difficulty medium i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together supplies size g hook will make approx 9 doll size e hook for adding hair yarn use red heart super saver or similar small amounts of each  black shoes cape hat  white  brown fun fur for hair  maroon and yellow for shirt scarf  blue jean color for pants  a color for the skin tone you ll also need  black pipe cleaner to make his glasses or feel free to use any colors you like gauge is unimportant for this project terms single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half-double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch increase = increase two single_crochet in same stitch decrease = decrease crochet two stitches together ch1 t = chain 1 turn flo = front loops only blo = back loops only note this doll is worked in the round i join rounds and i single_crochet in the same space as joining so i m assuming that at the end of each round you are slip stitching to the first stitch of that round and that you chain 1 to start the next round you can work in spirals if that s easier for you just remember to mark your rounds you want your stitches tight and close together so the stuffing doesn t show through later on to start each piece you can chain 2 and work your 6 stitches into the 2nd stitch from the hook or you can use the magic adjustable loop page 2 of 7 copyright sherri bush sherri crochets & crafts http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush contact me at sherricrochets@gmail com the legs body and head row instructions stitches **left leg** 1 using white 14 chain 6 2 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next chain 3 single_crochet in last single_crochet working on back side of chain 2 single_crochet in next chain single_crochet in next
